Directions: 1. Melt butter over low heat in a heavy-bottomed saucepan or stockpot. Whisk in flour very slowly. 2. Gradually add garlic, lemon juice, chicken broth, and artichoke bottoms and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 25 to 35 minutes. 3. Remove solids and place in a food processor or blender. Process until smooth, gradually adding remaining broth. Add pepper and serve. Variations:
Cream of Artichoke: Decrease chicken broth by 1/2 cup and add l/2 cup heavy or light cream to pureed soup.
Substitute two 14-ounce cans artichoke hearts, packed in water, for the artichoke bottoms. Recipe By : Sally Nirenberg: Recipes from the Night Kitchen 1991
